snippet.title: Lawrence Hall of Science
snippet.description: Run by U.C. Berkeley, Lawrence Hall of Science was designed to introduce two through 18-year-olds to the joys of science, and it does so with the type of playfulness that only comes when people who love science set out ...

snippet.description: This museum of science is rivaled only by the Exploratorium in San Francisco. It's really an amazing place, with a gazillion interactive exhibits, live animal shows, live science demonstrations, and...

snippet.title: Minutes to Memories: The Science of Nachos
snippet.description: Eight years ago, if you told me happiness could be found in a messy mound of nachos, I would have smiled politely and looked for the nearest exit. Bliss in a pile of tortilla chips, melted cheese, sour cream,...

snippet.description: Chicago is known for its world-class museums, but this one -- the largest science museum in the Western Hemisphere -- truly stands apart: More than 35,000 artifacts are housed in 400,000...

snippet.title: Oregon Museum of Science and Industry
snippet.description: Visiting the OMSI is fantastic fun for the whole family. There's the Science Playground where kids ages 0-6 conduct experiments (like playing with 'flubber' and watching scientists make 'oobleck'), play...
